instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: l820-00165 Missing PM_SLP_S4_
threads.message:
HI all,

This board was liquid dmg.

around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> After replacing <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and some caps i got <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> , <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> . but mising slp singal.

I replaced <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and i got fan spinning, <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> but no chime as missing <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL>.

I replaced it again 3 times but missing slp signal again. checked the rials any short but nothing. Also replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>. Clock signal and vrtc accurate.


Any clue?

threads.title: l820-00165 Missing PM_SLP_S4_
threads.message:
Probably crap accumulated under BGA chips.
You should start reballing SMC.

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> must pulses before you bother with <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.
